alert.note: Alert for Jackson; Kiowa; Tillman (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 04 at 8:46AM CDT until June 06 at 7:00AM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory is extended for the following rivers in Oklahoma... North Fork Red River near Headrick affecting Tillman, Kiowa and Jackson Counties. ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL TUESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...North Fork Red River near Headrick. * WHEN...Until Tuesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 13.0 feet, Near bankfull stages or higher occur along the river occur in Kiowa... Jackson... and Tillman counties. Upstream points in Kiowa County may see high stages several hours before the crest reaches the Headrick area. The crest reaches downstream points near Tipton much later. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:00 AM CDT Sunday the stage was 9.7 feet. - Bankfull stage is 13.5 feet. - Forecast...The North Fork Red River is expected to rise to a crest of 12.9 feet tomorrow morning. - Action stage is 12.0 feet. - Flood stage is 14.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 900 PM CDT.
